addIdentity(string,uint256,address).details: only callable by owner of smart contract

params._roleID: the role of the identity as integer representative

addIdentityOwnedBy(string,uint256,addres.details: only callable by owner of smart contract

params._roleID: the role of the identity as integer representative

addTestData().details: only callable by owner of smart contract

deleteIdentity(address).details: only callable by owner of smart contract
deleteIdentity(address).return: a boolean whether or not deleting was successful

getIdentityCreationTime(address).return: a unix timestamp. If the identity is unknown it returns the default (0)

getIdentityName(address).return: a unix string. If the identity is unknown it returns the default (empty string)

getIdentityOwner(address).return: an address. If the identity is owned by no one it returns the default address (0x0..)

getIdentityRole(address).return: a uint. If the identity is unknown it returns the default (0)

getIdentityRoleName(address).return: a string representative of the Role. If the identity is unknown it returns the default (Role.None)

identityExists(address).return: returns true if the identity is known

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

getAddress().notice: gets the address of this contract

getIdentityCreationTime(address).notice: gets the creation time of the identity

getIdentityName(address).notice: gets the name of the identity

getIdentityOwner(address).notice: gets the owner of the identity (if it is a device)

getIdentityRole(address).notice: gets the role of the identity

getIdentityRoleName(address).notice: gets the role of the identity

identityExists(address).notice: checks whether the identity is known or not

testConnection().notice: tests the connection to the smart contract
